summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between federal prosecutors and a defense attorney, Christine Delince, regarding the status of Christian Perez. The emails discuss Perez's sentencing in an underlying case and his potential involvement in the Epstein suicide investigation, with Delince having been assigned to represent him for any related questioning.

persons.name: Christian Perez
persons.context: He was sentenced in an underlying case and is a subject of inquiry regarding the Epstein suicide investigation. An attorney was assigned to represent him for potential Epstein-related questioning.

persons.name: Christine Delince
persons.context: Attorney from The Law Offices of Onaodowan and Delince, PLLC, who was assigned to represent Christian Perez for any potential conflicts or questioning related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jason Foy
persons.context: Referenced as the current attorney for Christian Perez in his underlying case. He provided Christine Delince's contact information to prosecutors.

persons.name: Montell Figgins
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the defense attorneys to whom notes were produced pursuant to a Protective Order in the case involving Christian Perez.

connections.description: Delince was assigned to represent Perez for any potential conflicts or questioning related to the Epstein investigation.
Foy is described as Perez's current attorney continuing to represent him on his underlying case.
Foy informed Delince that prosecutors wanted to speak with her about Perez, indicating coordination between attorneys.
Both are listed as defense attorneys who received produced notes in the case involving Christian Perez.

events.title: Assignment of Counsel for Perez
events.description: Christine Delince was assigned to represent Christian Perez in January 2020 for any potential conflicts or Epstein-related questioning.

events.title: Prosecutor Confirms Perez Sentencing
events.description: A federal prosecutor states that Christian Perez was sentenced in their case and inquires if anything else is expected with him regarding the Epstein suicide investigation.

locations.context: The office address for The Law Offices of Onaodowan and Delince, PLLC, where Christine Delince works.

keyFacts: Christian Perez was sentenced in a federal case by October 2020, but prosecutors were inquiring about his potential involvement in the Epstein suicide investigation.
Attorney Christine Delince was specifically assigned in January 2020 to represent Perez for any potential conflicts or questioning related to the Epstein matter, separate from his underlying case.
The email chain shows coordination between multiple defense attorneys (Jason Foy, Montell Figgins, Christine Delince) and federal prosecutors regarding Perez's legal representation.
Notes related to the case were produced to defense attorneys under a Protective Order, with some information on an 'Attorney's Eyes Only' basis.
